page.title: 06INDUSTRY IN THE 19TH-20TH C.
page.content:
THE INFLUX OF POPULATION ATTRACTED BY THE MINING INDUSTRY WAS REFLECTED IN THE POPULATION FOR THE BURGH OF AIRDRIE - IN 1831 IT WAS 6,594 BUT THIS GREW RAPIDLY TO 12,418 BY 1841.
{ COALMINING IN THE EAST MONKLANDS {BEGAN TO DECLINE IN THE 1920'S.}MANY SEAMS WERE NOW EXHAUSTED AND WITH THE DECLINE IN IRON AND STEEL, THE MARKET FOR COAL WAS SHRINKING. ABSENCE FROM THE MINES DURING THE 1926 STRIKE CAUSED{MASSIVE FLOODING PROBLEMS, {CAVE-INS AND BUILD-UP OF BLACK DAMP. AS A RESULT MANY MINES WERE CLOSED FOREVER. WITH THE LOSS OF JOBS IN THE COAL MINES, MANY MINING FAMILIES LEFT THE AREA TO SEEK EMPLOYMENT ELSEWHERE AND{MANY OF THE SMALL MINING VILLAGES {SOON DIED.}SOME ARE NO LONGER IN EXISTENCE.
